bug.author: sin-en-2009
bug.summary: IndexError: tuple index out of range
bug.description:
Describe the bug Traceback (most recent call last): File "D:/work/develop/pythonProject/keyword_recommand/data_analysis.py", line 73, in <module> report = pp.ProfileReport(data) File "D:\work\develop\virtualenv\keyword_recommand\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\__init__.py", line 68, in __init__ description_set = describe_df(df) File "D:\work\develop\virtualenv\keyword_recommand\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\model\describe.py", line 551, in describe correlations = calculate_correlations(df, variables) File "D:\work\develop\virtualenv\keyword_recommand\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\model\correlations.py", line 184, in calculate_correlations correlations["phi_k"] = df[selcols].phik_matrix(interval_cols=intcols) File "D:\work\develop\virtualenv\keyword_recommand\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 2940, in __getitem__ data = self._take(indexer, axis=1) File "D:\work\develop\virtualenv\keyword_recommand\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\generic.py", line 3359, in _take verify=True) File "D:\work\develop\virtualenv\keyword_recommand\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\managers.py", line 1350, in take axis=axis, allow_dups=True) File "D:\work\develop\virtualenv\keyword_recommand\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\managers.py", line 1231, in reindex_indexer fill_tuple=(fill_value,)) File "D:\work\develop\virtualenv\keyword_recommand\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\managers.py", line 1297, in _slice_take_blocks_ax0 blk = self.blocks[blkno] IndexError: tuple index out of range To Reproduce We would need to reproduce your scenario before being able to resolve it. Data: Report_Id Report_Date Search_Keyword Demand_Count Match_Keyword 0 280909 2019-10-16 ‰ΩúÊñáÁ∫∏Êù° 67 NaN 1 280910 2019-10-16 Ê∑òÂÆù 437 NaN 2 280911 2019-10-16 AMAP 5 NaN Match_Count Impression_Count Click_Count Download_Count Income_Money 0 36 26 1 2 40000 1 421 14 0 1 46700 2 1 1 1 1 18000 Max_PayPrice Min_PayPrice Avg_PayPrice Orgin_Type tag Strategy_Id 0 20000 0 1194.029851 110 0 38188 1 46700 0 213.729977 110 0 36849 2 18000 0 7200.000000 110 0 30891 adpos_id dtr eCPM 0 159 0.076923 1.538462e+06 1 351 0.071429 3.335714e+06 2 351 1.000000 1.800000e+07 Code: Preferably, use this code format: """ Test for issue XXX: https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/XXX """ import pandas as pd import pandas_profiling as pp
data = pd.read_csv('data.zip', header=0, sep=',', compression='zip', index_col=0) report = pp.ProfileReport(data) Version information: Version information is essential in reproducing and resolving bugs. Please report:
Python version:3.6.7 Environment: IDE (PyCharm, ), pip: If you are using pip, run pip freeze in your environment and report the results. The list of packages can be rather long, you can use the snippet below to collapse the output.
Click to expand Version information
<<< Put your version information here >>> numpy==1.16.3 pandas==0.24.2 pandas_profiling==2.3.0
Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

Could you provide a link to (part) of the data? In it's current form, we cannot reproduce the issue.
Hi! I'm curious did you solve the problem?

Hi! I'm curious did you solve the problem? Thank you for your concern, my problem has been solved, but at the expense of the amount of data, and I can get results quickly after deleting several columns of data for complex categories (about 300,000 or so different categories of data). Your project has given me a very handy way to analyze and present data, thank you very much! I'm sure it would be more helpful if more graphs could be customized to choose from when presenting data, and I hope your project gets better and better and provides more people with concise and quick data analysis. Thanks again üëçüëçüëçüëç
